729159f-a.title: Richmond: Montgomery Avenue - Victory Boulevard
729159f-a.text:
129 to 143 Montgomery Avenue, north of, adjoining, and
at the N. E. corner of Victory Boulevard.
April 19, 1929
P. L. 5perr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Detail of the same, showing the old 2-story frame hose,
number 131. Across the roof of the house is the rear of
the telephone building, fronting on St. Marks Place.
April 19, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO RE.RODUCTIONS

729803f-a.title: Richmond: Van Duzer Street - St. Pauls Avenue
729803f-a.text:
561-563 Van Duser Street, east side, at St. Pauls
Avenue. This old brick house was owned by J. Oneill in 1874
and by Chas. Rosenberg from 1907 to 1917. Dates refer to
maps on which the owners' names appear.
July 8, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729803f-a.folder: Van Duzer Street & St. Pauls Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729160f-a.text:
Montgomery Avenue, north from (No. 121) but not
including Victory Boulevard.
April 19, 1929
P. L. Sperr

729605f-a.title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Van Duzer Street
729605f-a.text:
St. Pauls Avenue, east side, south of Van Duzer
Street, showing the Cnapel of Our Lady of Consolation (R.C.)
aud the abandoned fire house of Engine 204, Tompkinsville.
June 1, 1927
P. I. Sperr

729796f-a.title: Richmond: Van Duzer Street - St. Pauls Avenue
